summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class using the Organization service proxy provided by the user.

members.member:
Initializes a new instance of the class using the instance provided by the user.
The instance provided by the user.
Use CrmServiceClient constructors to connect to Dynamics 365

Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified network credentials and authentication type as AD or IFD
Initialized network credential object to sign in to Microsoft Dynamics CRM.
Authentication type requested. Supported values are: AD or IFD.
Name of the server that hosts the Microsoft Dynamics CRM web or discovery service.
Port number on the server that hosts the Microsoft Dynamics CRM web or discovery service (usually 5555).
Organization name that you want to connect to.
Optional. Indicates whether to reuse an existing connection, if recalled while the connection is still active. Default is false. If set to true, will force the system to create a unique connection.
Optional. Defaults to null. If set, this is returned from a query to the Discovery service, and is generally used as the second leg of an organization selection process.
Optional. Indicates whether to use SSL to connect to Microsoft Dynamics CRM. Defaults to false, that is, uses http://. If set to true, uses https://.
Use CrmServiceClient constructors to connect to Dynamics 365

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified network credentials and Active Directory (AD) authentication.

param.name: credential
param.para: Initialized network credential object to sign in to Microsoft Dynamics CRM.

param.name: hostName
param.para: Name of the server that hosts the Microsoft Dynamics CRM web service.

param.name: port
param.para: Port number on the server that hosts the Microsoft Dynamics CRM web service.

param.name: orgName
param.para: Organization name that you want to connect to.

param.name: useUniqueInstance
param.para: Optional. Indicates whether to reuse an existing connection, if recalled while the connection is still active. Default is false. If set to true, will force the system to create a unique connection.

param.name: orgDetail
param.para: Optional. Defaults to null. If set, this is returned from a query to the Discovery service, and is generally used as the second leg of an organization selection process.

param.name: useSsl
param.para: Optional. Indicates whether to use SSL to connect to Microsoft Dynamics CRM. Defaults to false, that is, uses http://. If set to true, uses https://.

members.member:
Initializes a new instance of the class using a connection string.
The connection string. More information: Use connection strings in XRM tooling to connect to Dynamics 365
Use connection strings in XRM tooling to connect to Dynamics 365

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the using the OAuth protocol to connect to your CRM Online instance in Office 365.

param.name: crmUserId
param.para: User name for connecting to CRM Online instance in Office 365 using OAuth.

param.name: crmPassword
param.para: Password for connecting to CRM Online instance in Office 365 using OAuth.

param.name: crmRegion
param.para: Geographic region of your Office 365 server where CRM Online is deployed. Valid values are NorthAmerica, EMEA, APAC, SouthAmerica, Oceania, JPN, CAN, IND, and NorthAmerica2. If you specify , search will be run for servers in all the regions.

param.name: orgName
param.para: CRM organization name that you want to connect to.

param.name: useUniqueInstance
param.para: Indicates whether to reuse an existing connection, if recalled while the connection is still active. If set to true, will force the system to create a unique connection.

param.name: orgDetail
param.para: This is returned from a query to the Discovery service, and is generally used as the second leg of an organization selection process. You can set it as if you do not want to specify a value in the request.

param.name: clientId
param.para: The Client ID assigned when you registered your application in Microsoft Azure Active Directory or Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS).

param.name: redirectUri
param.para: The redirect URI of the application you registered in Microsoft Azure Active Directory or Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS).

param.name: tokenCachePath
param.para: The full path to the location where the user token cache should be stored. The running process should have access to the specified path.

param.name: externalOrgWebProxyClient
param.para: The instance to connect to CRM.

param.name: promptBehavior
param.para: Specify whether the user is prompted for credentials if the credentials are not supplied. Valid values are: (always prompts the user to specify credentials), (allows the user to select in the login control interface whether to display the prompt or not), or (does not prompt the user to specify credentials; if using a connection method does not have a user interface, you should use this value).

members.member:
Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified network credentials and authentication type as Office 365.
User name for connecting to CRM Online instance in Office 365.
Password for connecting to CRM Online instance in Office 365.
Geographic region of your Office 365 server where CRM Online is deployed. Valid values are NorthAmerica, EMEA, APAC, SouthAmerica, Oceania, JPN, CAN, IND, and NorthAmerica2. If you specify , search will be run for servers in all the regions.
CRM organization name that you want to connect to.
Optional. Indicates whether to reuse an existing connection, if recalled while the connection is still active. Default is false. If set to true, will force the system to create a unique connection.
Optional. Indicates whether to use SSL to connect to Microsoft Dynamics CRM. Defaults to false, that is, uses http://. If set to true, uses https://.
Optional. Defaults to null. If set, this is returned from a query to the Discovery service, and is generally used as the second leg of an organization selection process.
Indicates whether to use Office 365 authentication. If true, uses office 365 authentication.
Build Windows client applications using the XRM tools

Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified network credentials and claims-based authentication.
User ID to sign in to CRM.
Password to sign in to CRM.
Domain name to use for signing in to CRM.
Home realm URI of the user.
Name of the server that hosts the Microsoft Dynamics CRM web or discovery service.
Port number on the server that hosts the Microsoft Dynamics CRM web or discovery service (usually 5555).
CRM organization name that you want to connect to.
Optional. Indicates whether to reuse an existing connection, if recalled while the connection is still active. Default is false. If set to true, will force the system to create a unique connection.
Optional. Indicates whether to use SSL to connect to Microsoft Dynamics CRM. Defaults to false, that is, uses http://. If set to true, uses https://.
Optional. Defaults to null. If set, this is returned from a query to the Discovery service, and is generally used as the second leg of an organization selection process.
Build Windows client applications using the XRM tools

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified network credentials and OAuth protocol.

param.name: crmUserId
param.para: User ID to sign in to CRM.

param.name: crmPassword
param.para: Password to sign in to CRM.

param.name: domain
param.para: Domain name to use for signing in to CRM.

param.name: homeRealm
param.para: Home realm URI of the user.

param.name: hostName
param.para: Name of the server that hosts the Microsoft Dynamics CRM web or discovery service.

param.name: port
param.para: Port number on the server that hosts the Microsoft Dynamics CRM web or discovery service (usually 5555).

param.name: orgName
param.para: CRM organization name that you want to connect to.

param.name: useSsl
param.para: Indicates whether to use SSL to connect to Microsoft Dynamics CRM. Defaults to false, that is, uses http://. If set to true, uses https://.

param.name: useUniqueInstance
param.para: Indicates whether to reuse an existing connection, if recalled while the connection is still active. If set to true, will force the system to create a unique connection.

param.name: orgDetail
param.para: This is returned from a query to the Discovery service, and is generally used as the second leg of an organization selection process. You can set it as if you do not want to specify a value in the request.

param.name: clientId
param.para: The Client ID assigned when you registered your application in Microsoft Azure Active Directory or Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS).

param.name: redirectUri
param.para: The redirect URI of the application you registered in Microsoft Azure Active Directory or Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS).

param.name: tokenCachePath
param.para: The full path to the location where the user token cache should be stored. The running process should have access to the specified path.

param.name: externalOrgWebProxyClient
param.para: The instance to connect to CRM.

param.name: promptBehavior
param.para: Specify whether the user is prompted for credentials if the credentials are not supplied. Valid values are: (always prompts the user to specify credentials), (allows the user to select in the login control interface whether to display the prompt or not), or (does not prompt the user to specify credentials; if using a connection method does not have a user interface, you should use this value).

summary.para: Route an entity to a public queue.

param.name: entityName

param.name: queueName
param.para: Name of the queue to route the entity to.

param.name: workingUserId
param.para: ID of the user to set as the working system user.

param.name: setWorkingByUser
param.para: if true Set the worked by when doing the assign

param.name: batchId
param.para: Optional. If set to a valid GUID (generated by ), will assign the request to the batch for later execution. Otherwise, runs the request immediately.

summary.para: Cancel Sales order

param.name: salesOrderId
param.para: Sales order id to close

param.name: fieldList
param.para: List of fields to add

param.name: orderStatusCode
param.para: Status code of the order

param.name: batchId
param.para: Optional: if set to a valid GUID, generated by the Create Batch Request Method, will assigned the request to the batch for later execution, on fail, runs the request immediately

summary.para: Closes the Activity type specified. The Activity Entity type supports fax , letter , and phonecall
*Note: This will default to using English names for Status. if you need to use Non-English, you should populate the names for completed for the status and state.

param.name: activityEntityType
param.para: Type of Activity you would like to close.. Supports fax, letter, phonecall

param.name: activityId
param.para: ID of the Activity you want to close

param.name: stateCode
param.para: State Code configured on the activity

param.name: statusCode
param.para: Status code on the activity

param.name: batchId
param.para: Optional: if set to a valid GUID, generated by the Create Batch Request Method, will assigned the request to the batch for later execution, on fail, runs the request immediately

returns.para: true if success false if not.

summary.para: Closes an Incident request in CRM, this special handling is necessary to support CRM Built In Object.

param.name: incidentId
param.para: ID of the CRM Incident to close

param.name: fieldList
param.para: List of data items to add to the request, By default, subject is required.

param.name: incidentStatusCode
param.para: Status code to close the incident with, defaults to resolved

param.name: batchId
param.para: Optional: if set to a valid GUID, generated by the Create Batch Request Method, will assigned the request to the batch for later execution, on fail, runs the request immediately

summary.para: This will close an opportunity as either Won or lost in CRM

param.name: opportunityId
param.para: ID of the opportunity to close

param.name: fieldList
param.para: List of fields for the Opportunity Close Entity

param.name: opportunityStatusCode
param.para: Status code of Opportunity, Should be either 1 or 2, defaults to 1 ( won )

param.name: batchId
param.para: Optional: if set to a valid GUID, generated by the Create Batch Request Method, will assigned the request to the batch for later execution, on fail, runs the request immediately

summary.para: Closes a quote as won or lost, Revise is not supported via this method

param.name: quoteId
param.para: ID of the quote to close

param.name: fieldList
param.para: List of fields that need to be updated

param.name: quoteStatusCode
param.para: Status id of the quote, must be greater then 3 but not 7

param.name: batchId
param.para: Optional: if set to a valid GUID, generated by the Create Batch Request Method, will assigned the request to the batch for later execution, on fail, runs the request immediately

summary.para: Closes a Trouble ticket by ID

param.name: ticketId
param.para: ID of the Ticket to close

param.name: subject
param.para: Title of the close ticket record

param.name: description
param.para: Description of the closed ticket

param.name: batchId
param.para: Optional: if set to a valid GUID, generated by the Create Batch Request Method, will assigned the request to the batch for later execution, on fail, runs the request immediately

returns.para: Returns the ID of the closed ticket

summary.para: Associates one Entity to another where an M2M Relationship Exists.

param.name: entityName2
param.para: Entity on the second side of the relationship

param.name: entity2Id
param.para: The Id of the record on the second side of the relationship

param.name: relationshipName
param.para: Relationship name between the 2 entities

param.name: batchId
param.para: Optional: if set to a valid GUID, generated by the Create Batch Request Method, will assigned the request to the batch for later execution, on fail, runs the request immediately

param.para: Entity that you are relating from

param.name: sourceEntitieIds
param.para: ID's of the entities you are relating from

param.name: relationshipName
param.para: Name of the relationship between the target and the source entities.

param.name: batchId
param.para: Optional: if set to a valid GUID, generated by the Create Batch Request Method, will assigned the request to the batch for later execution, on fail, runs the request immediately

param.name: isReflexiveRelationship

returns.para: true on success, false on fail

summary.para: Creates a new activity against the target entity type

param.name: description
param.para: Description Text of the Activity

param.para: ID of the Entity to associate the Activity too

param.para: User ID that Created the Activity *Calling user must have necessary permissions to assign to another user

param.name: fieldList
param.para: Additional fields to add as part of the activity creation

param.name: batchId
param.para: Optional: if set to a valid GUID, generated by the Create Batch Request Method, will assigned the request to the batch for later execution, on fail, runs the request immediately

returns.para: Guid of Activity ID or Guid.empty

summary.para: Uses the dynamic entity pattern to create a new entity record.

param.name: entityName
param.para: Name of entity to create a record.

param.name: valueArray
param.para: List of initial values in the new entity record.

param.name: applyToSolution
param.para: Optional. Applies the update with a solution by unique name.

param.name: enabledDuplicateDetection
param.para: Optional. If , duplicate detection is enabled; otherwise .

param.name: batchId
param.para: Optional. If set to a valid GUID (ID returned by the method), the request is assigned to a batch for later execution. If you do not specify a value in this parameter, the request to create an entity record runs immediately.

returns.para: Returns a GUID (entity record ID) on Success; Guid.Empty if the request fails.

summary.para: Adds an option to a pick list on an entity.

param.para: Entity Name to Target

param.name: attribName
param.para: Attribute Name on the Entity

param.name: locLabelList
param.para: List of Localized Labels

param.name: valueData
param.para: integer Value

param.name: publishOnComplete
param.para: Publishes the Update to the Live system.. note this is a time consuming process.. if you are doing a batch up updates, call PublishEntity Separately when you are finished.

returns.para: true on success, on fail check last error.

Indicates that the credentials should be persisted to the disk if registration fails with DeviceAlreadyExists.

remarks.para: If the device already exists, there is a possibility that the credentials are the same as the current credentials that are being registered. This is especially true in automated environments where the same credentials are used continually (to avoid registering spurious device credentials.
